# Get user input
n, k = map(int, input().split())
s = input()

# Determine if the k-th character is uppercase
if s[k-1].isupper():
    # If so, lowercase it
    s = s[:k-1] + s[k-1].lower() + s[k:]

# Print the result
print(s)

# get input
N, K = input().split()
N = int(N)
K = int(K)
S = input()

# convert Kth letter to lowercase
S_list = list(S)
S_list[K-1] = S_list[K-1].lower()
S = "".join(S_list)

# print output
print(S)

N, K = map(int, input().split())
S = input()

print(S[:K-1] + S[K-1].lower() + S[K:])

def main():
    n, k = map(int, input().split())
    s = input()
    s = s[:k-1] + s[k-1].lower() + s[k:]
    print(s)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

def main():
    # Get input
    N, K = map(int, input().split())
    S = list(input())

    # Lowercase Kth character
    S[K-1] = S[K-1].lower()

    # Print result
    print(''.join(S))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
